document.title: New Jersey Student Learning Standards English Language Arts (NJSLS-ELA)

EF36F89C05174A7D806C3D168A1E678E.description:
Produce complete sentences when appropriate to task and situation in order to provide
requested detail or clarification.

E8463DE7F7C341919E607701504D42B7.description:
Use multimedia; add drawings or other visual displays to stories or recounts of experiences
when appropriate to clarify ideas, thoughts, and feelings.

AD6D9473709C48C78F8661777472685F.description:
Tell a story or recount an experience with appropriate facts and relevant, descriptive details,
speaking audibly in coherent sentences.

98E6F4B6CCE64ECC9B504E1C56E65520.description:
Ask and answer questions about what a speaker says in order to clarify comprehension, gather
additional information, or deepen understanding of a topic or issue.

83D4F5FA620741DCBB4EDE8E5FBC4E11.description:
Recount or describe key ideas or details from a text read aloud or information presented orally
or through other media.

D55562C4963D4AAF8AD5F55F0F8C8D7F.description:
Ask for clarification and further explanation as needed about the topics and texts under
discussion.

EEF3E02D1B484A7FB743BEEFFCB7A093.description:
Build on others' talk in conversations by linking their explicit comments to the remarks of
others.

5EC171C5C2FB4700B8CF34EDE34BF498.description:
Follow agreed-upon norms for discussions (e.g., gaining the floor in respectful ways, listening
to others with care, speaking one at a time about the topics and texts under discussion).

A2AFB98DD28E4C83BCF7F99FA7A874E5.description:
Participate in collaborative conversations with diverse partners about grade 2 topics and texts
with peers and adults in small and larger groups.

C16EB0E51DD446BEA8D52D79B733A506.description:
Engage in both collaborative and independent writing tasks regularly, including extended and
shorter time frames.

7E87AC041F4B473BBB663135ACEEF1A8.description:
Prioritize information provided by different sources on the same topic while gathering ideas
and planning to write about a topic.

97CAA90BC7E44FB4BE17F8DB0A091760.description:
Generate questions about a topic and locate related information from a reference source to
obtain information on that topic through shared and independent research.

2EB8B1150AF542D9A96CE9808EF8606C.description: With feedback and digital or print tools such as a primary dictionary, find and correct errors.

0B25282D9D5B45A8BFEEB471B271C98D.description: Participate in self-evaluation of written work.

522D281E54F34B3D848D899C985A696C.description: Identify audience and purpose before writing.

AF8B6EE9394A4855B5534A620F540C97.description:
With guidance and support from adults and peers, develop and strengthen writing as needed
by planning, revising and editing.

4B2A6480070B496AA13F17458F1D70B7.description: Provide a conclusion or sense of closure related to the narrated experiences or events.

3672B7E59FCD4E1E91682EAB4454206E.description: Use concrete words and phrases and sensory details to convey experience and events.

DB9F89F9DF4F428BA9271343D37DA981.description: Use transitional words to manage the sequence of events.

7FE6B92A84344A85BB77BA6951BBBFD0.description:
Provide dialogue and description of experiences and events and/or show the responses of
characters to situations.

A957D0DCF9DE43D7845B01FA2C82496D.description:
Orient the reader by establishing a situation and introducing characters; organize an event
sequence.

CF81501A4ECA4EA39431685A88A67EA4.description: Write narratives based on real or imagined experiences or events with basic story elements.

95FF6A2E55BE4799ABDAD135EA3353EB.description:
Develop a topic with facts definitions, concrete details, text evidence, or other information
and examples related to the topic.

AE417278AF1D4E9486D51124556FFD86.description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas and information.

9051A7C0A4FB41E4B35802F2798CCCBC.description:
Support the opinion with facts, definitions, concrete details, text evidence, or other
information and examples related to the topic.

9442362254224165AAE25E72FEA184F0.description:
With prompts and support, write opinion pieces to present an idea with reasons or
information.

AF8E5DCD098143AEBBC0BC88E95F7EAF.description:
Compare and contrast two informational versions of the same idea or topic by different
authors or authors from different cultures.

1FBBBFE5654B41E0954AA542759D7753.description:
Compare and contrast literary versions of the same story (e.g., Cinderella stories) by different
authors or from different cultures.

506CAF582F2F4872A7B2371B19A42573.description:
Describe and identify the logical connections of how reasons support specific points the
author makes in a text.

1B36E2B0944B47D196C240DDEEF48B0E.description:
Explain how specific illustrations and images (e.g., a diagram showing how a machine works)
contribute to and clarify a text.

5E3821A2C4BB47D9B4BCA968E4575A3D.description:
With prompting and support, use information gained from the illustrations and words in a
print or digital text to demonstrate understanding of its characters, setting, or plot.

1EAE65E90C0048A284494211B6D9BDC1.description:
Identify the main purpose of a text, including what the author seeks to explore, answer,
explain, or describe.

FA3EF4228D3A4B228D3A236F0CA582D3.description:
Acknowledge differences in the points of view of characters, including by speaking in a
different voice for each character when reading dialogue aloud.

945B277345344FDD98B7E5D694AA4CAC.description:
Describe the overall structure of a text and effectively use various text features (e.g., graphs,
charts, images, captions, bold print, subheadings, glossaries, indexes, electronic menus, icons) to locate
key facts or information.

00DD22C0286C4EF3BCD02C8F7567FC75.description:
Describe the overall structure of a text, including describing how the beginning introduces the
story and the ending concludes the action, identifying how each successive part builds on earlier
sections.

5749A9F2B64D49E4BA1E99FD90C8F6D9.description:
Describe the connection between a series of historical events, scientific ideas or concepts, or
steps in a sequence within a text.

9E5F6EDAE89B4378BEB03D27B3D01997.description:
Describe how characters in a story respond to major events and challenges using key details
within a text.

AA9A3C16FAB248E2A2F05CF7FC46BC07.description:
Recount a text in oral and written form and determine main topic (in multi-paragraph
informational text, focusing on specific paragraphs).

C589FBEB14EF4A2890E9BD621490D032.description:
Recount a text in oral and written form and determine central message (in literary texts, e.g.
fables and folktales from diverse cultures) .

2400870E81D944F7A400551A99246E93.description:
Ask and answer questions to demonstrate understanding of key details in an informational
text, referring explicitly to the text as the basis for the answers.

44CB1CF9DF4B4CA88AC8299A5ECEE49F.description:
Ask and answer questions to demonstrate understanding of key details in a literary text,
referring explicitly to the text as the basis for the answers.

C22F2AE18F3C486EA357490C99762B63.description:
Describe how words and phrases (e.g., regular beats, alliteration, rhymes, repeated lines)
supply rhythm and meaning in a story, poem, or song.

C0322317BF324A3CAA7FF4F65DA0BDDE.description:
Distinguish shades of meaning among closely related verbs (e.g., toss, throw, hurl) and
closely related adjectives (e.g., thin, slender, skinny, scrawny).

826AC512E61B4A1D95EF16134370EF2C.description:
Identify real-life connections between words and their use (e.g., describe foods that are
spicy or juicy).

19D32D8F3033413EA813CBC7D170314E.description:
Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships and nuances in word
meanings.

0B33A570646E486FBA18ADAAA9BBCFC3.description:
Use glossaries and beginning dictionaries, both print and digital, to determine or clarify the
meaning of words and phrases.

B19D2C44543F4FB785B360376CF555CD.description:
Use knowledge of the meaning of individual words to predict the meaning of compound
words (e.g., birdhouse, lighthouse, housefly; bookshelf, notebook, bookmark).

F8D0D52CC93F42FC8D7A463AAB6DBB43.description:
Use a known root word as a clue to the meaning of an unknown word with the same root
(e.g., addition, additional).

63C8310D86AC4ED79CF3EE953B8F25BB.description:
Determine the meaning of the new word formed when a known prefix is added to a known
word (e.g., happy/unhappy, tell/retell).

BA2E3BB95AF64FF0A73F6C78CD57BAC1.description: Use sentence-level context as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

B06AB1164EBD4A13AB5F102BAE913F42.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based
on grade 2 reading and content, choosing flexibly from an array of strategies.

CC4F3745635E457A8E2D8A805AE95A82.description: Compare formal and informal uses of English.

F93E220FDC6E40178980E0E7320407F3.description:
Use words and phrases acquired through conversations, reading and being read to, and
responding to texts.

18FFD523F792446784786E1C3FEA03CF.description: Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or listening.

6BCC746779024C3F94A690EBD23D0A5E.description: With assistance, link sentences into a simple, cohesive paragraph with a main idea.

CD7D97AFE16341A3A5514CE1C4020DC8.description: Use an apostrophe to form contractions and frequently occurring possessives.

E5D830BED5794883B180246A0182E2DA.description:
Punctuate dates, abbreviations, greetings and closings, initials, important words in a title,
and items in a list.

51C45BE5363441B5BE06533977364D7F.description:
Identify the verbs in clauses; form and use regular and irregular verbs for consistent use of
past, present, and future tenses.

9CB2E6C0E3944E379E538643359B53C0.description: Supply adjectives in noun phrases to make them more precise or engaging.

9A5D711645C24581B2DB16F31ADAE07F.description: Capitalize holidays, product names and geographic names.

0A2BDBFF49A641D790B916925BF17412.description:
With modeling or prompting, separate run-on sentences and identify fragments, supplying a
subject or predicate as necessary.

EC3064D0DD0E4AC3AD994D14BEBF27CF.description:
Demonstrate command and use of the conventions of writing including those listed under
grade one foundational skills.

6238F47D76604243BEAD4B442BA00236.description:
Most often used words in English:
i. Irregular words (against, many, enough, does).
ii. Pattern-based words (which, kind, have).

C4B97251E31A466E8D947C2E3F1560ED.description:
Words with suffixes that require:
i. consonant doubling (penning, slimmed).
ii. dropping silent-e (smiled, paving).

E57B127D06BB41BC85EE46BAFAF52D67.description:
Regular two- and three-syllable words that:
i. Combine closed, open, vowel team, vowel –r and CVe syllables (compete; robot;
violet; understand).
ii. Are compounds comprising familiar parts (houseboat; yellowtail).
iii. Include the most common prefixes and derivational suffixes (un, re, en; -ful, -ment,
-less).

669356C47DB742C1B82F406BB9B7FF3B.description:
Regular, single-syllable words that include:
i. Position-based patterns (ch, -tch; k, -ck; -ge, -dge).
ii. Complex consonant blends (scr, str, squ).
iii. Less common vowel teams for long vowels (ow, oo, au, ou, ue).
iv. Vowel-r combinations (turn, star, third, four/for).
v. Contractions (we’ll; I’m; they’ve; don’t).
vi. Homophones (bear, bare; past, passed).
vii. Plurals and possessives (its, it’s).

2DBD58B1EF9547C28EF55DC341C4EA7A.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of encoding and spelling.

103C7D549E154AC6A9979F50790F79F3.description:
Write the most common graphemes (letters or letter groups) for each phoneme, for
example:
i. Consonants: /s/ = s, ss, ce, ci, cy; /f/ = f, ff, ph; /k/ = c, k, -ckii. Vowels: /ō/ = o, oe, oa, ow; /ā/ = a, a_e, ai, ay, eigh.

D1374AC218BA439DBD57E391C0DB14A3.description: Write legibly and with sufficient fluency to support composition.

8A6812F426CF4CE4A1C50B2DF09C315F.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of writing.

3CF515B5D63A4A06AB2052A105DB80CD.description:
Use context to confirm or self-correct word recognition and understanding, rereading as
necessary.

F8BD6FBC694B462889982AB3DD279857.description: Read grade-level text orally with accuracy, appropriate rate, and expression.

EC0E728775514D978A4A965CE9D12DD1.description: Read grade-level text with purpose and understanding.

11096FBB145A4187B9D0323C44966810.description: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension.

4C313B3111D2430DAF7F36B5FF3BDEFC.description: Identify the parts of high-frequency words that are regular and the parts that are irregular.

D63889CB41784B24B55A73F31CEE6B4C.description:
Read high-frequency and grade-level irregular words with automaticity (e.g., friend, other,
would).

0D3B0B6320B04512B1FC5615F697BE62.description: Recognize and read grade-appropriate irregularly spelled words.

1BB9F47C1F9248DC9349399984776D05.description: Identify words with inconsistent but common spelling-sound correspondences.

2751AAB95C204F5893F3569B4C75FB26.description: Decode words with common prefixes and suffixes.

B6A9C5C5B7834A58BC37805853D0174B.description: Decode regularly spelled two-syllable words with long vowels.

BC54A8D2A43B43CB8124AC621C084247.description: Know spelling-sound correspondences for common vowel teams.

E8A37EFA71614AA3A4283AD7C2B77054.description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words.
